name: Macedonia
declaringWar: You are in my way, you must be destroyed.
attacked: As a matter of fact I too grow weary of peace.
defeated: You have somehow become my undoing! What kind of beast are you?
introduction: Hello stranger! I am Alexandros, son of kings and grandson of the gods!
tradeRequest: My friend, does this seem reasonable to you?
uniqueName: We need to take India right fucking now
uniques: [+2] Movement <in [Enemy Land] tiles> <for [Land] units>
[+1 Culture] per [2] population [in annexed cities]
[+2 Culture] per [2] population [in annexed cities] <during a Golden Age>
uniqueText:
+2 Movement for all land units in enemy territory. 
+1 [Culture] for every 2 population in annexed cities, doubled during Golden Ages.

name: Athens
defeated:
Beautiful Athens... you've plunged humanity into a dark age... 
Bad End.
introduction: I greet you on behalf of Athens as her elected representive; behold the bastion of enlightenment and mother of the Ionians.
hateHello: Come to give up your throne, tyrant?
tradeRequest: Trust me, this agreement will benefit us all the most.
uniques: Cannot build [Settler] units
[-50]% City-State Influence degradation
City-State Influence recovers at twice the normal rate
Militaristic City-States grant units [3] times as fast when you are at war with a common nation
[+3 Science, +3 Culture] per [2] social policies adopted
[+1 Culture] from all [Science] buildings
Can spend Gold to annex or puppet a City-State that has been your ally for [12] turns. <after adopting [Representation]>
uniqueText:
City state influence recovers at twice the speed and degrades half as fast. 
+3 [Science] and +3 [Culture] for every other social policy adopted. 
+1 [Culture] from all [Science] buildings. 
Can annex allied CS with [Gold] after 12 turns of alliance have passed and Representation is adopted (TBR). 
Cannot build settlers.
spyNames: Dada da du du da do do mo ne bam ba bah

name: Sparta
declaringWar: Laconia's fields require fresh helots, and her markets slaves. The weak should fear the strong; we shall enforce that natural order now.
attacked: Sparta shall never submit to foreign Cravens! Aries smiles upon us, barbaroi. You will not be walking away from this one.
defeated: No... our society was infallible, indestructable... at least we will die with it as Spartans.
hateHello:
I would have settled our differences on the fields of battle, were we not currently preoccupied declaring war on our peasant class. 
You call it madness, we call it Sparda.
tradeRequest:
This is our offer. 
We shall await your reply at the edge of a comically sized pit.
uniques: Cannot build [Settler] units
[+1 Production, +1 Culture] from all [Barracks] buildings
[+1] population [in capital] <upon conquering a city>
Free [Worker] appears <upon conquering a city>
Free [Melee] appears <upon declaring war with a major Civilization>
[-20]% Unhappiness from [Population] [in all cities with a garrison]
[+50]% Unhappiness from [Specialists] [in capital]
All newly-trained [Gunpowder] units [in capital] receive the [Agoge] promotion
All newly-trained [Sword] units [in capital] receive the [Agoge] promotion
[+50]% Production when constructing [Military] units [in capital]
uniqueText:
+50% [Production] of military units in the capital. 
Gain 1 population in the capital and a worker upon conquering a city, and a free melee unit when declaring war. 
All Infantry units receive the Agoge Promotion 
Cannot build settlers.
spyNames: The Rolling Corpse of Ayn Rand

name: Thebes
declaringWar: I think it's best we deal with you now, before you become a bigger problem.
defeated: I leave behind no sons, and I do not fear death. But even the most blessed of men are one day doomed to watch their mothers die before them; as Thebes burns before me, what blessing are my own victories if they could not preseve her legacy?.
introduction: Greetings! I have been appointed to speak for Thebes, Boeotia, and all its people. May our relationship be prosperous.
neutralHello: Something you wish to tell me?
hateHello:
Now, we shouldn't let old grudges distract us from our mutual intrests. 
Nothing washes down bad blood like Theban wine.
tradeRequest: I think this arrangement could benefit us both, yes?
